Toolbox¶

The isopy toolbox contains an number of useful functions for processing and evaluating geochemical data. You can access the toolbox through the isopy.tb namespace.

Isotope Data Processing¶

The following functions are useful for processing isotopic data.

normalise_data(data, reference_data[, …])

Normalise data to the given reference values.

denormalise_data(data, reference_data[, …])

Denormalise data to the given reference values.

find_outliers(data[, cval, pmval, axis])

Find all outliers in data.

johnson_nyquist_noise(voltage[, resistor, …])

Calculate the Johnson-Nyquist noise and counting statistics for a given voltage.

make_ms_array(*args[, mf_factor, …])

Constructs an isotope array where the first created isotope contains the sum of all given isotopes with the same mass number.

make_ms_beams(*args[, mf_factor, maxv, …])

Simulates a series of measurements with a standard deviation equal to the johnson-nyquist noise and counting statistics.

make_ms_sample(ms_array, *[, fnat, fins, …])

Creates a simulated the measurement of a sample with natural and instrumental mass fractionation added to the array.

mass_independent_correction(data, mf_ratio)

A quick function for mass-independent data correction.

calculate_mass_fractionation_factor(data, …)

Calculate the mass fractionation factor for a given ratio in data.

remove_mass_fractionation(data, …[, …])

Remove exponential mass fractionation from data.

add_mass_fractionation(data, …[, …])

Add exponential mass fractionation to data.

remove_isobaric_interferences(data, …[, …])

Remove all isobaric interferences for a given element.

ds_inversion(measured, spike[, standard, …])

Double spike inversion

ds_correction(measured, spike[, standard, …])

ds_grid(standard, spike1[, spike2, …])

Regressions¶

Below are functions for calculating regressions

regression_york1(x, y, xerr, yerr[, r, tol])

Calculate the slope and intercept taking into account the uncertainty on x and y where the uncertainties represent 1 SE/SD.

regression_york2(x, y, xerr, yerr[, r, tol])

Calculate the slope and intercept taking into account the uncertainty on x and y where the uncertainties represent 2 SE/SD.

regression_linear(x, y)

Calculate a linear lest-squares regression for two sets of measurements.

Plotting¶

Below are functions for plotting geochemical data using matplotlib

update_figure(figure[, figwidth, figheight, …])

Update the figure options.

create_subplots(figure, subplots, *[, …])

Create subplots for a figure.

plot_scatter(axes, x, y[, xerr, yerr, …])

Plot data points with error bars on axes.

plot_regression(axes, regression_result[, …])

Plot the result of a regression on matplotlib axes.

plot_spider(axes, y[, yerr, x, constants, …])

Plot data as a spider diagram on matplotlib axes .

plot_vstack(axes, x[, xerr, ystart, …])

Plot values along the x-axis at a regular y interval.

plot_hstack(axes, y[, yerr, xstart, …])

Plot values along the x-axis at a regular y interval.

plot_vcompare(axes[, cval, pmval, sigfig, …])

A comparison plot for data sets on a vstack.

plot_hcompare(axes[, cval, pmval, sigfig, …])

A comparison plot for data sets on a hstack.

Colors()

Rotate through a set of colours.

ColorPairs()

Rotate through a set of colour pairs consisting of a matching dark and pale colours.

Markers()

Rotate through a set of markers.
